skill.name: use-gemini-for-code-analysis
skill.description: AI-powered codebase analysis using Gemini CLI to scan projects, identify patterns, trace implementations, and map architecture relationships across large codebases.
skill.summary: Analyze large codebases with Gemini CLI for architecture insights and pattern detection

security_audit.summary: This skill is a CLI wrapper for the Gemini code analysis tool. All static findings were false positives: cryptographic algorithm warnings referred to metadata hashes, high entropy was due to Chinese documentation, and shell commands were documentation examples. The skill executes external commands legitimately through the gemini CLI for code analysis purposes.

low_findings.title: External Command Execution
low_findings.description: The skill executes the gemini CLI tool for codebase analysis. This is the intended functionality and poses minimal risk as the skill only wraps the official Gemini CLI without injecting malicious parameters. Users should ensure they trust the gemini CLI installation on their system.

content.user_title: Analyze Codebases with AI-Powered Gemini CLI Integration
content.value_statement: Manually exploring large codebases wastes time and effort. This skill integrates Gemini CLI to provide instant AI-driven architecture analysis, pattern detection, and code relationship mapping across entire projects.
actual_capabilities: Execute Gemini CLI commands to analyze entire codebases with AI assistance
Identify code patterns, architectural decisions, and module relationships
Trace feature implementations across multiple files and directories
Scan for code quality issues, performance bottlenecks, and security concerns
Generate architecture overviews and component mapping for large projects
Support custom analysis prompts in multiple languages including Chinese
limitations: Requires Gemini CLI to be installed and configured on the system
Analysis quality depends on Gemini CLI capabilities and configuration
Does not interpret or post-process analysis results, returns raw output
Limited to features and file types supported by Gemini CLI

use_cases.title: Architecture Review for New Team Members
use_cases.description: Help developers joining a project quickly understand the overall architecture, main components, data flow patterns, and key design decisions without spending days reading code.

use_cases.title: Security Audit Pattern Detection
use_cases.description: Scan large codebases to identify potential security vulnerabilities, code smells, or anti-patterns that need attention before production deployment.

use_cases.title: Legacy Code Modernization Planning
use_cases.description: Analyze legacy systems to identify outdated patterns, technical debt, and refactoring opportunities to prioritize modernization efforts effectively.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Pattern Search

prompt_templates.scenario: Finding specific design patterns across the project

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Overview
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the overall architecture of this application and identify main components, data flow, and directory structure
prompt_templates.scenario: Getting a high-level understanding of project structure

prompt_templates.title: Feature Implementation Trace
prompt_templates.prompt: Trace the complete implementation of the user authentication feature, showing all involved files and integration points
prompt_templates.scenario: Understanding how a specific feature works end-to-end

prompt_templates.title: Security and Performance Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Scan for potential performance bottlenecks, security vulnerabilities, and code quality issues throughout the codebase
prompt_templates.scenario: Comprehensive code quality assessment before release

output_examples.input: Analyze the API routing structure in this project
output_examples.output: The skill executes gemini CLI and returns: Analysis shows 3 main API route groups located in src/routes/. User routes defined in users.js handle authentication endpoints. Product routes in products.js manage CRUD operations. Admin routes require middleware authentication checks defined in middleware/auth.js.

output_examples.input: Find all database query patterns used in this application
output_examples.output: The skill executes gemini CLI and returns: Found 2 main query patterns. Direct SQL queries used in legacy modules under lib/legacy/. ORM pattern with Sequelize models found in models/ directory. Recommend migrating legacy SQL to ORM for consistency. Total 47 query locations identified.

best_practices: Specify clear and focused analysis goals in your prompt to get more actionable results
Use specific keywords when searching for patterns or features to improve accuracy
Review the raw output carefully as the skill does not filter or interpret results
anti_patterns: Asking overly broad questions like analyze everything without specific focus areas
Expecting the skill to interpret or explain Gemini output, it only returns raw results
Running analysis without having Gemini CLI properly installed and authenticated

faq.question: What is Gemini CLI and do I need to install it separately?
faq.answer: Gemini CLI is Google's AI-powered code analysis tool. Yes, you must install and configure it independently before using this skill. The skill acts as a wrapper to execute Gemini commands.

faq.question: Does this skill work with any programming language?
faq.answer: The skill supports any language that Gemini CLI can analyze. This typically includes most popular programming languages, but check Gemini CLI documentation for specific language support.

faq.question: Will the skill interpret or summarize the analysis results?
faq.answer: No. This skill is designed as a CLI wrapper that returns raw Gemini output without interpretation. You or your primary AI assistant will need to review and process the results.

faq.question: Can I analyze codebases with sensitive or proprietary code?
faq.answer: Analysis happens through Gemini CLI on your local system, but be aware that Gemini may send code to Google servers depending on your configuration. Review Gemini CLI privacy settings before analyzing sensitive code.

faq.question: How large can the codebase be for analysis?
faq.answer: Size limits depend on Gemini CLI capabilities and your system resources. The skill uses the all-files flag which attempts to analyze the entire repository. Very large repos may take longer or hit token limits.

faq.question: Can I customize the analysis prompts or add new analysis types?
faq.answer: Yes. You can provide any custom prompt through Claude Code when invoking this skill. The skill will construct the appropriate gemini CLI command with your prompt and execute it.
